Player History
Traded from Toronto to Chicago on 7/31/1985 (Going to CHC: 1B Cecil Fielder, 3B Mike Sharperson, CF Ruppert Jones. Going to TOR: P Floyd Bannister, P Ron Davis, CF Keith Moreland)...
Had first career hit on 8/1/1988, off Tom Browning (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/3/1988, off Allan Anderson (CIN)...
Traded from Chicago to Montreal on 5/11/1989 (Going to MON: CF Ken Griffey Jr., 1B Cecil Fielder, C Craig Biggio, C Rick Wilkins. Going to CHC: P Randy Johnson)...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/8/1990, hitting .500 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1990, hitting .310 with 16 HR, 32 RBI...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Sets a new season NL-Record for HR with 46 on 9/26/1990...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,735,714 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,735,714 through salary arbitration...
Won Batter of the Month award on 5/1/1992, hitting .315 with 9 HR, 29 RBI...
Injured on 6/25/1992 with a Inflamed Abdominal Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
